content:
Those interested in Swing and Latin music can take classes offered by UT Professional and Personal Development starting Sept  PERIOD

Mary Jerger coordinator for the dance classes said that no prior dance experience is necessary PERIOD

 Jerger said PERIOD

The participants are from a mixture of backgrounds PERIOD

 Jerger said PERIOD

People taking the class are not required to bring a partner but it is strongly encouraged PERIOD

Tony DeDominick and Fay Hacker instruct the classes PERIOD The two have  years of experience in teaching dance combined PERIOD

The swing classes will focus on East Coast Swing which can be used to dance to most forms of swing music including songs from the big bands of the 1940s and recent bands such as Big Bad Voodoo Daddy and The Squirrel Nut Zippers PERIOD

The Latin class will focus on dances such as the Mambo Rumba and Tango PERIOD

Jerger said that once students know how there are many places in Knoxville to dance PERIOD She suggested the Fairbanks Roasting Room and Michaels as local outlets PERIOD

The classes will be held at Farragut Performing Arts located at  Campbell Station Road PERIOD Classes are offered Wednesday nights from  to  or from  to  PERIOD The cost of the class is  but people registering together receive a  discount PERIOD

Also offered are Ballroom Dancing and Cajun Dancing PERIOD

Ballroom dancing will consist of instruction in classic dances such as the waltz fox trot and chacha PERIOD Ballroom dancing will be offered Wednesday nights  to  PERIOD

The Cajun dance class a new offering will include instruction in the Cajun waltz twostep jitterbug and the basics of zydeco PERIOD Jim Lawler will teach the Cajun dance class PERIOD The class will cost  and will be offered Wednesday nights  to  PERIOD

Class dates and times are still being set PERIOD For more information or to register for any of these classes call UT Professional and Personal Development at  or visit their Web site at www.outreach.utk.eduppd PERIOD
